content: white screen of death after trying to redownload at least 15 times... it is very frustrating, considering i paid for it already.... update.... have tried contacting the developer and have gotten no response. has been a waste of time and money!

App needs to be updated as I can no longer open it. I just get a white screen of death telling me that the app had an installation error and needs to be reinstalled. And no, reinstalling it does not help.

Just gone back to this wonderful game.... I missed the last update. Updated, now I get a white screen. Given the recent reviews I might just delete it and play via steam. Any help with the white screen, please?
Risk on steroids

Intolerable. First, on single-player mode the AI is dumb as dirt yet knows the exact scoring cards in my hand and will throw itself against continents that it knows I have with dumb, overpriced attacks. Second, the number of dice rolls for 1 is much greater than mere chance. Looks like the devs couldn't create a clever AI and just gave the player a serious handicap to compensate. The single-player mode is the worst part of the game - I usually just quit after rolling multiple 1's on first turn

content: Very enjoyable game, well adapted from the board game version! The only feature that is missing and would seriously improve my experience is not auto-winning when the time is up but rather be able to flag for win when you want to at any later point in time but also continue playing if that's what you prefer. That's the way it's usually done in games like chess and allows continuing interesting games.

Loved this game, worked well, had to uninstall it for awhile but have just reinstalled it and all I get it a white screen! Using google pixel 4, same phone as last time but now app not working. Shame, was my favorite...
replyContent: Hi Sam! So sorry you're experiencing this issue! Please forward this to support@playdekgames.com and we'll assist you from there. Thank you for your support!

content: Love this game! App makes it easy to see all of the different aspects of the board game you normally track. Takes the pain out of calculating too.
Perfect Game

A perfect interpretation of the board game.
Great game, great adaptation

Twilight Struggle is one of favourites and this app version is fantastic, especially ehen playing with new people to teach them the rules or to refresh after not playing for a while. However the Android 10 update on the Pixel 2XL at least has broken the game and it no longer loads. I have emailed the support team and hope to hear back from them to see if they can fix it, it would be a real shame if it stays in this state. Will mark back up to 5 starts when fixed.

Absolutely love the game and app would be OK, but I'm currently totally unable to install the app from PlayStore on my OnePlus Nord and attempts to contact customer service have been unsuccessful.
Great game and app!

Great game. My only complaint is that the game will let you play a card that will automatically cause you to lose outright. This is extremely frustrating and has ended many games.

Bugs fixed. Great game. An issue playing online: some ppl will let the timer run all the way to 0 once they're convinced they lost, hoping that the winning player forfeits first in order to save the time. There should be some mechanism to let others flag ppl that do this as a warning to other prospective opponents in the future
Great game that does a good job representing the board game.

App was great until latest update. Devs didn't see to test with pixel 3XL because the notch wasn't accounted for and now I can't cancel or click the back button when playing cards. Basically unplayable now.

The 11th Sept 2020 update has broken the game making it impossible to play. This phenomena of developers breaking perfectly good apps is a warning to us all that we don't 'own' an app - we've merely rented it. Don't be surprised to see a newer, working, near identical app appear to buy again.
The latest update is horrible.

Bought the expansion, when I updated the OS on my phone it deleted the expansions and won't unlock. Not even the latest garbage updates gave the expansions back and its now super clunky on on phone. An expanding joke, this app.
Update ruined app. No notifications now on android when it's your move. If it ain't broke don't fix it. Very disappointed
September 9 update has significantly worsened my experience of the game. Slow, buggy, and spelling mistakes introduced. Please roll back the patch.
The last update ruined the games functionality and made it unplayable

Game was great until the September 9th update: card names messed up (Trumane doctrine, Koren war..), multiple issues with cards (evil empire shows TDTW text when selected), map not scrolling anymore, no notifications on Android, player profiles completely unreadable due to overlapping text... The increase in font size for the chat is the only useful update.

Sep20 update has broken this for me. Unable to scroll around the map manually, so tried using, continent specific cameras but they get locked-in place, plus everything moves around much slower then it used to
Great game but after the update, the scroll doesn't work. Also, the game is much slower now.

Wonderful game, one of the best and a lot of fun playing online with others. If you get really into it, join a league and compete! But the recent update is terrible. Card names messed up (Trumane doctrine for one) and map can't pan anymore. No useful features added (60 min games). If not for that this would be a solid 4

Flagging a bug where on the andriod version of the app you cannot scroll down or up to see the top or bottom of board. This means that you cannot see or place influence in either Argentina or Norway. Only happening since update
Excellent adaptation.
Awesome. No bugs. Just work right like the board game
App worked fine since March, now they appear to have discontinued it for the Pixel 2 - won't install at all.
Excellent digital implementation of an outstanding 2-player strategy game.
Text is tiny. Game not designed for touchscreen but seems like a port.

Amazing. Printed version is of course excellent, and Android adaptation couldn't possibly be better. No problems on 6,4 inch screen, but thanks to magnifying I'm certain it works well on smaller screens as well.
Great 2 player game!
Does not work on Android 10
Not for me I thought I would like it but it was just not for me. To be honest I want a refund
Amazing game and app! Great job guys!
Excellent experience, brilliant base game. It does crash sometimes, but has so far faultless autosave, so I've never lost a turn. Such a joy to have on the phone. :)
Great game

Pretty accurate version of the original board game. Few crashes here and there (nothing game breaking) and it is almost impossible to check cards currently in play (lost a star just for this, it's really bad - the icons are the size of a match-head!) But it does the job and is a lot faster then cracking out the actual tabletop version.

Massive bug: Soviet player wins every headline, but the rule is that if equal or better op value for US, US starts. Most other things are great, I will update my review when this bug is solved. Also: maybe make the icons of 'relevant event cards' like NATO enlargeable (with text).
Great reimplementation of the tabletop game.
One of the best boardgames there is. Can't launch the game on Android 10

Editing to 5 stars as it has started working on android 10 and oneplus 7t. The game was always phenomenal. ------------------ Game and app were great until changing from 3t to 7t and the new Android. Unable to install the game on the new phone, says installation failed, and the game does not start.
Vuelve a funcionar con Android 10
Excessive permission requests: Photos(!) and contacts. No reason for either.
Often crashes. Variety of glitches when using the offline game with two human players. Asmodee Digital has ruined many digital versions of popular board games.

Edit: Seems broken on Android 10. Can't launch. There is no reason this needs my contacts. Another great Asmodee mobile version of a board game. Rules are strictly enforced so makes a great way to learn the game. AI is decent. Devs should have trained it to use original rules that both players lose on Defcon 1. I've had some AI Defcon suicides. Soviet AI seems to prioritize 1st turn Coup Iran even with 2+ US handicap.

I've owned the original board game version for a few years now, so I can say with the utmost confidence that this port is identical to what is one of the best selling "wargames" in existence. High replayability, excellent theme, perfect mechanics. Get it!
Dont purchase. Game crashes after 2 turns. Pathetic
It's great game. Physical as well this electronic adaptation unfortunately can't install anymore on Android 10 any chance fixing this ? It was android issue after latest update works again

Just purchased and installed yesterday, but it only allows me to play a portion of Turn 1 and then crashes, so I haven't been able to play a full game, and doesn't save progress. Quite disappointing since this is a purchased app.
Better then the original. Wasn't disappointed. Allows games faster then the board game. Good times.
Struggling to install this game on a new phone. Game is great, otherwise.
Great game, but stopped working after I upgraded to a new Samsung phone.
The software doesn't download correctly! I've tried all of the troubleshooting tips, and it still doesn't work.
Brilliant port! One question. On a Note9, the History tab on each card in the Gallery is blocked by the announcement bar and I cannot tap it to read the history. How do I go around it?
Uninstalled then reinstalled now hangs on start up

Very good adaptation of the boardgame. There are only two things stopping me from giving it 5 stars: 1) At least 2 cards that are in the boardgame are missing - NORAD and Special Relationship. This makes the game even more balanced in favour of the USSR than the boardgame. There may be others missing but these are the only two I have noticed so far. 2) The game crashes sometimes
This was a great implementation of the board game on my pixel 1. It hangs during start up on my pixel 4 and is therefore unplayable.

Literally an exact port of the version you can find on Steam, which is fantastic. Several annoying issues that make this inferior to the desktop version, however. The "on the board" special condition tiles (e.g. NATO, Flower Power, etc.) are not really viewable, as you can't hover a cursor over them like on a computer. Additionally, the game won't let you purchase the additional content, and despite repeated inquiries to the developers I have gotten no response on how to remedy this.
I thought I was going to hate this game, but here I am 20 hours later still plugging away at it. Might want to pull get a player aid pdf from BGG and keep it open in the background.
Does not work. I am unable to fully install the game and get an error message each time I try.
My old phone died. Reinstalled game. Now the expansion doesn't work again. Emailed playdek and no response. Games timed out an and I lost.
replyContent: Please contact support@playdekgames.com and we'll get you straightened out.  We've tracked down the source of the IAP problem and we're working on releasing an update to fix it.

content: The only thing i really can complain about is that i can't buy the turn zero stuff

Twilight Struggle is a masterpiece of a game, and this app really does it justice. UI is simple, graphics and music are great. The tutorial really teaches the game well, so much that I recommend this app to anyone wanting to learn the tabletop version. Highly recommended.

Great digital implementation of a great board game. However, it does have a few glitches, the most significant I've hit was my inability to restore the expansion content when I changes devices. Cue to the WORST possible support experience: ive tried contacting support on 3 occasions, all attempts end up with a request for more information, you reply to it, following which you are promptly ignored and receive no further communication. Very unprofessional: (Edit: 10 times now:(((, no response)

Truth be told, it reminds me of legacy risk. Pretty interesting but I wouldn't say it's for first time beginners in the genre of board games. Got it on sale so that is a plus and it is rated as one of the best board games of all time.

The game itself is solid, but that's just because it's the same as the board game. The AI is not very good. Unfortunately it doesn't seem like there's been any updates in a year, so I'm guessing this won't change. The UI is okay. After playing Android board game adaptations like Through the Ages though, it's difficult to find much it does well. I've played 3 games and the app has crashed 3 times. It's not particularly stable. Love this game. Purchased to try it before buying the board game.

Update: Does not work on Pixel 3. I love the boardgame. The app however is one of the most one sided experiences I've ever had. The AI advantages make it next to impossible to do well much less win. I started tracking die rolls after my suspicions were raised. In over 150 rolls for space race I was successful in less than 40%. The AI was successful in 75% of its rolls. Would much rather have a good AI than one supported by ridiculously favorable die rolls.
Great game. Excellent digital implementation

Definitely worth every penny. Distills the essence of the cold war into an easily understood package, while staying true to the complexities of that era. Loads of fun, and the AI is no pushover, it WILL make you earn your victories.

Unable to play online as I try to login it says account not activated but I haven't received any activation email. Also unable to purchase turn zero expansion as nothing happens after pressing the purchase button.

Terrific board game. The app does a good job capturing it. One nice feature is that it helps newer players learn about defcon suicide by flagging potentially game ending situations - one of the most important aspects of the game. This app does crash consistently once per game. Nothing that patience can't overcome, I have never had a game that wouldn't continue after I reloaded a few times. One parting thought - the AI's success percentage with Indo-Pakistani War is ridiculously high.
Can someone please tell me why I STILL cant get my in apps purchases to work on this?! Getting annoyed. Love this game

content: have loved this game since the boardgame was first introduced. Like the app a lot, too. The music and sound effects really add to the atmosphere. Quibble: For some reason I can't purchase Turn Zero and Asmodee won't get back to me.

Great game, having said that I never win. dice rolls clearly in the AI favor also always seems to know what the next scoring card is. Maybe I just suck but this is how I feel. it's so fun and challenging though I still play it.
Clearly running in a (very poor) PC emulator. Runs like treacle and guzzles the battery even on a Mate 20 Pro. Avoid.
love it, but cannot buy turn zero for some reason
Maybe the best board game adaptation I 've ever played. Magnificent gameplay!

This is a great game but sometimes I seriously question the AI's judgment. For example it just committed Defcon 1 suicide by choosing to coup a battleground county on turn 2. It wasn't close to losing on the point track and it could've just placed influence instead. Similarly I've seen it choose not to coup on someone else's turn when it could've won defcon 1. It also doesn't seem to take the threat of losing by European control seriously, when Europe is dominated.

Not getting any confirmation email after creating an account. Really frustrating. Already emailed to the support team but no reply. Cannot login and create account!! UPDATE: PLAYDEK SUPPORT HELPED WITH THE ONLINE ISSUE AND I GOT TO PLAY THE GAME ONLINE NOW!!
A great game but the ai takes too long on its turn. Im not sure why this is but i want it to hurry up so i can spend 20 minutes thinking over my turn lol

The app and game are great WHEN IT DOESN'T CRASH. It's borderline unplayable with well over half of my games ending in unrecoverable crashes. I feel like the company stole my money, and I will never buy a game from them again.

content: Love this game.  Great job on the mobile side as well.  Works well with S5 neo - but is a huge battery strain.  Interface works well.  AI is at times frustrating.  It's pretty easy to win with no handicap,  so I usually put a 10 handicap for the opposing side I am playing which will make the outcome of the game unknown.   I am wondering if this handicap also affects the dice roll as it gets SUPER FRUSTRATING the coup attempts.  I have documented over 80 rolls/battles cards, etc..  I average 2.65 per coup roll, AI averages 3.9!!  Huge difference and at times makes it nearly impossible to win. They win nearly all war cards, and don't get me started on the imbalance of the re-alignment roles (can never win if even - I documented 15 losses in a row....when both +2).      This is my biggest complaint of the game.       2nd complaint would be the time AI takes to complete moves.  Perhaps it is the speed of my phone.  AI often makes ridiculous moves such as using a 1 ops card to battle a 3 country (and will win).  AI will often lose by nuclear war, and AI often seems to know which cards in my hand especially on headline phase (probably like playing someone really good with a good memory).
Love this game, even as a PC gamer. Probably among the best gaming currently possible on mobile.

Great game...to a point. So tired of losing to complete bullsh1t dice roll and card deal scenarios. I lost 8 realignment rolls in a row (same country) on an even chance. F#@K your rolls. I lost a 16 point lead because >90% of cards that came out in rounds 8-10 were blue or neutral. This happens a lot! F#@k your cards. Just 2 examples of utter stupidity from the game, totally ruining the enjoyment. I'll stick to the board game version...where I can accept real life probability and luck...good or bad.
Great boardgame Port.

A very good implementation of the game. Nice having cross platform play and no limit on screen size. It is playable on my five inch screen. Updated: Something is going on after the latest update with the rolling. It makes no sense the amount of 1s and 2s I roll versus what the computer is rolling.

This app works just as well as the PC game. The AI has gotten better, the audio and visuals are great, and I like the cross-platform play. Wish it was available for my friends who have iPhone though. Glad there are push notifications for multiplayer now. I'm not sure if I've just gotten so used the AI or if I've just gotten much better but the game has become ridiculously easy in singleplayer. I just won a game with 56 VP. I never lose, so this isn't a fluke. I usually only win by 20-30 VP though.
I lost my purchases like another that reviewed. I emailed and I'm waiting for a reply... Still no reply so stars go to 1 for bad customer service.

Really great game but some of the cards don't work properly. I played a card that should have prevented me from losing the game from defcom and had all UI suggest that to be true, then still lost. Wasted like 90 minutes.
Awesome game, but I can't purchase from the in-app store! Let me buy Turn Zero!

Great game, slightly high learning curve, but the app really helped me get into the board game version. Also, great for single player when you can't find someone to destroy you as the Soviets in early war
Just an amazing board game
Great game, but whyyyyyyy would have asynchronous gameplay without push notifications?
Only thing that's bugging me is the fact that you recieve emails every time your opponent makes their move but no notification from the app.
Very well done implementation of game, however suffers from frequent crashing for me which hampers the gameplay experience.

Fantastic game and getting many hours out of it. The persistent crashing 
has reduced since launch and the support team were great with an IAP 
problem for a new device. 5* service and game.
replyContent: Please contact support@playdekgames.com.  We're testing a potential fix that is specific to the Moto G4 device, and we'd like to be able to test if it works for you.  Thanks.

content: Great game, true to the actual board game. Minor rules inaccuracies.

content:
Twilight Struggle is truly one of the greatest board games ever created. It 
is a fantastic themed recreation of the Cold War, and expertly blends theme 
with gameplay. Very few games tell a story in the way that TS does. The app 
is, in general, a quality implementation of the game. The interface is 
excellent for such a complex game, Unfortunately, this app is marred by a 
number of bugs which have gone unfixed for a long time (the same is true of 
the Steam release). While these bugs are rare, they are almost always 
game-ruining: the game does not leave much room for error, and the bugs 
that are left usually cause major issues. The experience with the Turn Zero 
DLC is worse, and I strongly recommend that you do not purchase it. Enough 
of the cards are buggy, and effectively work contrary to their text, that 
almost every game is unbalanced by one of them. The AI is an excellent foe 
for new players, capable of defeating new to moderately experienced 
players. It does suffer, however, from occasionally making some 
spectacularly good moves, and it should pose no challenge to a seasoned 
expert. If you are a strong player, you can try to build challenges for 
yourself against the AI, such as dominating every region simultaneously, 
never couping, or reaching final scoring with the USSR controlling the UK.
Excellent port

I can't see any of the menus or the text on the cards on my chromebook, so 
:(

Asmodee Digital support

content:
A fine rendition of a top-ten BGG ranking board game. Very playable, nearly 
as much as the physical board game. Pros: Play Twilight Struggle anywhere 
and find people to play with rather easily via the multiplayer feature. 
Cons: 1 - On certain devices, card text isn't readable because of the 
aspect ratio. But fairly seasoned players should be able to remeber all the 
cards just by looking at the picture; 2 - No way to skip animations; 3 - No 
game log export Food the cons and it's a 5 for sure.
replyContent:
Hello, 

Many thanks for your feedback and support. 

Best regards, 
Asmodee Digital support

content: Great game but always crashes on setup so just wait it out until they fix it

One of the best board games. Takes a bit to figure out the strategy. I 
suggest starting as America and trying to counter the UUSR.
Great port of the boardgame, fantastic for long flights!

App is a fine implementation of a great board game. Would be 5 stars but 
the AI is incredibly weak if you have familiarity with the game. Not sure 
how hard it would be to improve but it loses every time. A few issues I've 
seen: no concern for Europe control, constantly wasting ops to break 
control but not adding any more influence so it just gets stuck in a loop 
of trading two ops for one, wasting events like CIA to look at my hand when 
there's literally one card in it (seen this multiple times).

This is a good game; however, it locked up when I played a card and tried 
the "Resolve Event First" option. Very frustrating. I use this app on a 
Samsung Chromebook, which is android capable.

Game crashes at the same point every single time. Too late to refund. Oh 
well

The AI appears to be rigged with terrible dice rolls. After playing 4 games 
I managed to roll nothing higher than a 2 when attempting a coup, while the 
AI rolled 5s & 6s. Only time I rolled high numbers is the space race 
rolls.. Shame really, the game is great.

Great adaptation of the board game! I have but one small suggestion: it 
might be a good idea to show how many cards there are still in the deck, so 
it's easier to count which cards are still in there.

Really impressive that they were able to get so many complex mechanics to 
display so elegantly on a small screen. A really great, functional, 
attractive port of the game. Two main things would make it a five star: Why 
are there no push notifications for Android? Seriously, seems like it 
shouldn't be that hard. The AI player makes lots of dumb mistakes. For 
example, allowed me to take Europe control uncontested, quite slowly and 
obviously, while it was concerned with Angola. Also it constantly wastes 
influence breaking control of my countries but doesn't properly follow up 
on the broken control. As a result, app is only useful for online play if 
you're experienced at all.

I greatly enjoy this app, being able to play my favorite board game 
anywhere. However, the AI leaves MUCH to be desired. I've seen it DEFCON 
suicide when there were clear ways around it, headline opponent's events 
when it had superior friendly events, play outside of regions it had the 
scoring card when it could have contested it, and send friendly cards to 
space/bear trap/quagmire when it had opponent's events.

Despite a fantastic transposition from tabletop game, the app crashes often 
kicking me back on desktop. Very annoing

Please make it more obvious that making a move will/could lose the game.  (i.e. Anything that pushes the DEFCON too low.) Super frustrating to not have a reminder on this, as the computer just lets you coup away or play cards that drop the DEFCON level. Obviously  I don't want to coup if it costs me the game.  So, I get frustrated, put the game down for a while, pick it up and then lose on these technicalities again get frustrated, put the game down... Just add a little reminder in there and the game would be a lot more enjoyable.  Literally one of the reasons I wanted to learn on the app, was so the computer could help me learn how to play. Letting me kill myself does not help with that.  (update): I think a simple "BACK" button that can be pushed at any time would be a nice solution.
So it still constantly crashes so glad I paid for it

Good game. Nice tutorial to teach you how to play. Lost 2 stars because it 
doesn't send notifications, very annoying having to message my mate I'm 
playing against every time I've played my turn.

The game crashes maybe 70% of the time when loading on my Moto G5+. 
Maddening when it happens 10x in a row. This is compounded by the app not 
keeping a game loaded if you lock the screen. The board game it's based on 
is amazing and it's a decent implementation. It's annoying to have to 
reconnect and reload a game every time you lock the screen, and the 
interface desperately needs a way to look at a card list of not-played-yet 
cards in game to go alongside the discarded/removed card lists.
One of the best port of a board game

Really great game and worth the higher price. My biggest issue is that the 
AI somehow doesn't lose when it reduces Defcon level to 1. I've now lost 
two games by the AI doing this.

This is a great app, however as of late it has been quite buggy, and 
randomly shut down frequently.

An excellent deep strategy game that can be had extremely cheap compared to the physical copy! The options each turn are numerous and you need to juggle a million different things. The AI is difficult to play against and you also have the option for alternate play conditions (as long as you buy the $.99 DLC). The app drips the game's theme and is an all around pleasure to play. Highly recommend you play it!
I want to give 5 star but my in apps purchased cant be restored after reinstall update.. please fix this..
75% of the time, TS app crashes when loading a game. Sent an email to support address, never heard back.  Great app....when it works.
Best strategyvgame of all time.

Its my favourite board game and even the app is perfectly similar to the real life... but.. Â¤ Dice rolls are totally unfair and irritating.. don't know what kind of algorithm you are using for it. Â¤ Finding players online takes lot of time. Â¤ If I had known about these issues would have got the steam game, instead of paying  here. Â¤ Give a 4-5 game play as trail version to gather more perople... Â¤ Ai when knows it will loose the game, the app crashes there itself. Â¤ If the Dice was atleast decent would have given full stars.
Perfect realisation of an amazing board game
Bad adaptation of a board game to digital. I really wanted to like it. Would return if possible
I wish I could play this game, but being a blind user with a screen reader, it is utterly inaccessible. I wish that this were not true and that I could give a better review of it
Please add a 60 minute multiplayer timer option and fix the mobile notifications issue... This would make the game just perfect.
Fun game and works well. The only thing missing is mobile notifications for multiplayer games - it only sends an email when it's your turn.
Great for gaming on the go or if you just don't get to play the physical edition often enough.

My star rating is for stability. 2 stars as when I open a game online it crashes 80% of the time !! Such poor QC !  If your still reading Twilight Struggle is ace as a game and when I do play, it is fantastic.

content: Really like the game which IÂ´m playing with my wife on the board version a lot. The app is great. The AI is strong but not invincible which it makes the game challenging, Only major complaint is:AI actions are waaaay too fast, I understand that you can look up the log but if everything was done more slowly you can get a better sense of what is going on. FIX IT (please)
replyContent:
Hello Alberto,

We forwarded your message to the teams so they can look into it.

Thanks for your support !

content: One of the best board games done very well on mobile!
The UI could use some options that you can turn off, and some of the buttons are a bit small for fat fingers like mine, but I have not had this much fun in a long time.
Great board game!

***Had to edit this score down. AI is quite annoying, have "lost" far too many games because of AI ignoring the defcon level.  Particularly a problem  when playing as the USSR. Resolving this issue would be a major improvement.***  This a great conversion, fully recommend it. There are occasional glitches - I've played a couple of games where its my action round and I can select cards but no action is possible (no option for how to play the card appears). The AI does have a tendency to ignore the defcon level leading to alot of games ending in nuclear holocaust, often with a message saying the AI side still won for some reason. So there are a few things to iron out but it's still great and I've spent ages playing it.
My version freezes every time I try to go online. Waste of money!!
There aren't logic in the game rules.
Amazing. Just like the board game.
As much as I hate the controls on PC, one can't deny how easy it is in a touch screen device.

The AI is far too weak if you have any experience with the boardgame. Game is good against a human opponent .. but against those playing face to face is way better still. So sadly this app does not serve a real purpose for me.
replyContent:
Hello, 

Many thanks for your feedback. 
Don't hesitate to contact the support: 
https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/twilight-struggle/

Best regards,

content: Great
A must have and play for political history and war gaming geek. Just finished the tutorial and can see what potential this game has. 1000's of hours of game play ahead.

This is a pretty nice digital version of the game, I've been mostly happy with it. The only thing I find annoying is that the Android notifications don't seem to work, meaning I have to use email notifications or just check randomly to see if it's my turn (would be 5 stars if this were fixed).
Great game, great interface. If you like the board game this is well worth your time. AI is a bit too easy, but the online play easily makes up for it. Best game purchase I've made in a long time.

Very clear board. Good sound. Steep learning curve. But there's a great tutorial. Also after reading a twilightstrategy beginner's guide you'll get to understand the excellent intricacies of the mechanics. The game is heavy but deep and satisfying.

I wanted this game to be good, so badly. The AI ruins it. It's impossible to win and you not only always lose, but lose big. The AI knows the cards in my hand, including my score cards. Fix the AI and this could be so much better.
replyContent:
Hello, 

Thanks for your feedback, be assured that we read all of them. 
Please note that the team is working on the game. 
Don't hesitate to contact the support: https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/twilight-struggle/

Best regards,

content: Amazing!!!
Every time I try to play the tutorial, the app crashes

Excellent board game, but the app crashes most of the time when loading a game on Moto Z2 Play, and inexplicable network disconnects (which force you to reload the game, rather than just hit a retry button) make it really quite hard to play a turn.

content: The title isn't a reference to the actual cold war but rather a very accurate description of the game. The twilight struggle is trying to find sleep at night when all you want to do is beat the Soviets.
Huge battery hog, and very buggy
Love the game, but the expansions kill the game engine. Too many freezes! Horrible QC for paid content guys!!
Far too arcane for the casual gamer.
Crashes every time I start a game. Unplayable.

This is great except the AI.  Not sure how the AI works in general, but it will defcon suicide (it played CIA created as USSR when Defcon was at 2 and there was USSR influence in Cuba...coup and win for USA...though unsatisfying win).    Not sure if the AI is being actively worked on, but I think at a minimum it should have guards against defcon suicide.  OK, found an even bigger issue than the AI defcon suicides...if you control Europe and Europe scoring is played...it doesn't win you the game!
Great implementation of a great game
Excellent app- online play is fantastic

Apart from the crappy AI that can't recognise event value the game is ok. Yes, no one wants an AI that beats you regularly, but in this case it could have been made a bit more aligned  with the two 'schools' of  thought - 'Theory' and 'Chinese'
Perfect adaptation.
Simply the best board game ever. So much fun and fiendishly difficult to master. Was so pleased when I saw it here on store

This is probably the best strategy game that I played. From the strategic standpoint, it's a nice hand management game where you play a card's event or use its point value to perform a different action such as placing influence in a country. Of course, each event is based off of one from the cold war's history. So prepare to learn more about the cold war as you play.
Excellent game.
Great game. Terrible App. Playdek does not support their products.

content: Fantastic port from the board game. Playing the AI is fun. It plays subpar, especially in the mid or late game where it seems lost, but with luck it can still win and still presents a challenge enough to keep the tension high. It also allows for handicaps so if you're winning too easily you can spot it extra influences or if you're struggling you can do the same for yourself.  It features online play and a rating system so you can play people at your level or people on your friend's list.  On the negative side it is prone to crash when starting a new game or continuing an older game, but it has never crashed during a game for me.  Also, some of the buttons are so small on the screen on a phone, particularly the ones that tell you what events are active, that it can be hard to click on them and read the text. Finally, it has in-app purchases where you can buy promo cards and the optional cards from the deluxe edition. The in-app purchases are nearly as much as the game itself. It's kind of cheap that they did it that way. They should just give you everything straight up. What's nice vs the board game is you can readily see the state of each region (it provides a meter), it keeps track of everything) and it highlights valid moves and warns you of defcon 1 or scoring card blunders.  This game is great fun and gives you the repetition you need to get familiar with the cards. Well worth the money.
Just great
Excellent rendition of the original
Good game, but it needs a confirm button when you Headline. Otherwise if you pick a card by accident you cannot get it back?
Simply amazing port of world famous board game. Thank you guys from Playdek inc.

For a guy just starting out in TS this is awesome. One suggestion. The tutorial section is great but there should be an index you can jump to a specific lesson. Example. If you want to under stand how realignment works or how and when can you do a coup.
really tried to get into this, but it's really boring, confusing, buggy, and plodding

Problems: AI player roles waaay  to well on coups while I regularly got 1 & 2's.  Might as well throw the card away.  Out of about 15 games, I don't recall getting a single 6.  Really takes the fun out of the game.  Problem: Constantly fighting with the screen controls.  Can't seem to see active cards that stay in effect, regional scoring buttons work intermittently.  Good: I liked the graphics, good looking screen.  Overall the game is okay, it captures the board game very well.  But the lopsided "luck" really detracts from the game.

Really like this. (A bit small on the phone mind though) Couple of questions. The AI wins when it reduces Defcon 1 on its turn. Tutorial says you will lose if you do this. And I do when I do it. Ahhhh seem to be when I play olympic games as event opponent declines
Great game and pretty easy to play on a phone given the amount of small detail. My main issue is how weak the AI is.

Placing influence can be tricky due to map size, but it's fixable if you can review your move before committing the decision. Great game for those who don't have lots of friends that like wargames because of solo mode against AI. It's also nice that it can be played in turns  if someome can't play the whole match at once. You can just make your move whenever possible.
TS is the best two-player boardgame in existence, and this app is a perfect translation!
Possibly the best board game ever, and now finally ported to Android and it is simply stunning.
Excellent board game. AI is great To learn the game.
A very good implementation of a great board game. Occasional crashes and infrequent stupid AI plays are annoying, but not a deal breaker.   Note - I have not played online, only against the AI.
Game is a fabulous strategy boardgame. A real brain burner. But it crashes on loading sometimes and no notifications is a basic shortcoming. 5 stars if these problems are fixed for Android.
The texts on the cards are way too small that I can hardly read. The game runs smoothly in general with only occasional crash. Overall fun game with nice design and adaptation.
Good game but crashed almost every time I tried to resume an online game. With no option to keep it running in the background this was very frustrating
Keeps crashing for no reason and at different points. Sometimes in the middle of a turn, sometimes nearing the end of the game, sometimes before it even loads, but very frustrating all around.
Whenever I load up a game I have a 25% chance for the app to crash. Very annoying, especially when playing by email. I have a Moto Z Play, please help me.
Great game but as with other users crashes on load screen 50%of the time. Moto g5 plus.

AI seems just OK. On turn 2 round 4, the soviet AI played Duck and Cover leading to a defcon suicide victory for me. That's seems to be a bug.  Also, I headlined a scoring card and the AI resolved it first and then the Soviet headline.  Another bug.  I'll keep playing though and see it things improve.  Played a second game. Tight game in turn 9. UI, as USSR, played Duck and Cover AGAIN! leading to another victory for me with defcon suicide.  This needs to be fixed!!

Extremely good game, though equally complex and the AI player is VERY difficult. I'd like to thank the developers for releasing this on android. It's a grown-up game that makes you feel proud to play. I've not seen this level of complexity even on consoles. Deeply facinating subject handled professionally. Highly recommended if you like civ type games.

If you play with a person i give it 5 stars, great adaptation of the board game. If you will be mainly playing the AI, 1 star, unless you enjoy looseing big every time... It's a fun game but if you play against the AI you loose. It does not make mistakes... ever. I enjoy this game, and was so excited when i found it as an app...  I am pretty good at the game in real life. Against the AI I play with a 10 point handicap and have still never made it to the end game before getting beat. They need to add some way to change the AI difficulty settings then 5 star. Until then this game was just a waste of money I'd take back in a heartbeat if I could.
Excellent port, AI is playable but not great
Great depth to this game! Achievements don't work tho. TIP: don't use de-Stalinisation card in Tutorial turn 2. It's bugged and your tutorial will proceed no further...
Didn't really enjoy it.
Great mobile implementation of a great board game. Essentially equivalent to the Steam version. Plays cross-platform.
Amazing game. Better and better with each replay.

The board game is great, but the app crashes often when attempting to load a game. This makes it very frustrating to play especially in online mode. At times after 2 or 3 times trying to load a game I just give up. Both myself andy brother have the same issue, we have different cell phone brands, live in different places but both have Androids. If it wasn't for the crashing I would give 5 stars.
Only con is ability to see the whole map at once
Own the app, own the cardboard...Hands down my favorite one-on-one boardgame, and the app is representative enough of the tabletop experience to merit purchase.
Needs Android notifications for when it's my turn.
This is the Timeless game of choosing the worst least option.
Doesn't let you play your second space race card
Best game ever, brutal, like a game of chess on every continent

Awesome game. Only downfall is one of the cards seems glitched: Non aligned movement. Sometimes it will let you remove influence from any country, not just the regions listed. I think it happens during mid war but not late war.

One of the best boardgames for sure. Lots of fun and strategic thinking. It'll give you hundreds of hours of joy. You won't regret buying it. It has some issues though. Notification system is not properly working. The game won't tell you when your opponent commits his movements. It only sends emails (seriously??). Also, cards and buttons are so tiny that on my Note 5, I'm forced to use S-pen.
It might be the Cold War, but it heats up my phone like a hot war!
Takes a little learning as it's a lot to do with what cards to expect later but worth it, a very fun little strategy game
A turn based game.......with no push notifications.........how did you forget that???????
Great mobile adaptation. Just two niggling points - a) why is there no auto log in ? b) can we have native android notifications (as opposed to spamming my email)?
Draining the battery, fast.
I like the idea of it, but the AI is very slow on my Pixel XL and I don't quite understand the mechanics of the game yet. Overall it is a great game with some room for improvement.
Excellent representation. Hi has a couple of issues with tiny icons in the the corners.

Fascinating game  I have been playing this game for four days straight. It's a very absorbing game which makes you question the decision of every move. It has a steep learning curve, of which I am still learning, and I wish the animations could be slower so that I could see exactly what the A.I. is doing (in order to learn from its moves). If you like war strategy games, particularly those based on real life war scenarios, you should enjoy this.
Please take my money!! So excited this is on mobile!
All good except AI is a little bit stupid
All in all a great game, it runs a tad slow on on my Asus memo pad but its still very playable, if you like having a game that makes you think, then this is the game for you....

Twilight Struggle is generally considered one of the best board games in circulation for hard core board game fans. I own a copy myself but being able to play this while travelling or in bed is totally worth paying for the app as well as the board game. I've already played 8 games, which is more than I've ever played with the board game version!
A great classic of boardgames faithfully ported to software, including multiplayer support. A must have.
Would be a great game, unfortunately the card 'de-stalinisation' causes the ai to hang. Any chance of a fix?
Superb version of a fantastic boardgame
Great game
Great port of a great game.  Well done Playdek.  Shame it took as long as it did but pleased it's here now.

The AI held a score card at turn 8 and lost. Checked the board again and confirmed no score card would hand me the victory. Care to write a hard code to require the AI to play all score cards before end of turn? It is frustrating to see it fail such a simple rule.

Excellent port of the Game.The tutorial text is both too small and badly color coded.Had to put brightness up a lot to properly read the text.Also the app drains a lot of battery.Please also consider increasing the max zoom as it could do with more on my 5.1 inch screen mobile.Otherwise Excellent!

Good game, though TS is so long I'm unlikely to play anything but AI matches.   I have two minor issues with this game.  1) The occasional bug that caused the game to freeze on reload. This has only happened once.  2) A couple times, the AI has decided to "fire ze missiles" and battle ground coup in Africa at defcon 2 with the China card. You might want to add in a "will this end the game check" into the code.
Need to fix the Non-Aligned Movement card, computer just took 4 influence off West Germany by headlining it
replyContent: Yes, it's a bug that only happens when there are no countries that match the criteria for Non-Aligned Movement.  It will be fixed in the next update.

content: Great port of a great game!
Why I can not install it in my huawei mate9!?

How many times do I have to spend $3.99 for the in-store purchase before it actually sticks on phone.   Dont buy the in-game content until they fix this issue.   You guys owe me 7.98+ thr ingame purchase....TWICE!   Fix the dang app!
replyContent: Please contact support@playdekgames.com and we'll get you straightened out.  We've tracked down the source of the IAP problem and we're working on releasing an update to fix it.

content: Would be really nice to have notifications to phone option for longer games
Battery Hog! A board game app should not use this much battery.
Didn't like the board game, don't like the app version either. However great work by the Dev team. App is well made.

The turn-by-turn tension and informed gamble of GMT's Twilight Struggle are here, unfettered by the UI. Undo and probability displays are very useful for casual play. The AI provides sufficient resistance to keep local games interesting. For more, there's online play.
Superb

Done very well, very clear, good tutorial and good community with async multiplayer. However, the multiplayer requires you to manually relogin to the game server every time you reopen the app (even if it's just 'minimized' to RAM.) There's probably a reason for this, but it's kind of a hassle if turns are being played quickly.
replyContent: It should reload directly to the online lobby if you exit the app while online with the update that was released today.  You'll still have to reload the game that you were in, so it's not perfect, but it is improved.

content: If you don't know this is based on a popular board game. It's medium hard to learn, although the tutorial is good. But to master, well you won't, trust me you wont, but you'll keep coming back for more! Very atmospheric, great game ð

Resolution on my HTC m9 is a little too small but you can zoom in on the map easily enough but seeing played events can be difficult to go back to. Interface is very intuitive and it's a great game, which I learned through the tutorial and a practice game.

A completely faithful reproduction of the board game, and a very intuitive UI!   However I can see that the in-game manual is confusing. The rule about loosing by DEFCON status is not at all clear (it's whoever played the Olympics card, not who chose to boycott; also be careful with the CIA Formed card if you are Russia). I hope they re-write some of the manual to more closely match  the board game's manual.
Thank you for getting this to android.

This is by far the most anticipated board game app of all time and yet so few downloads. It's a great learning tool and can play much faster than the physical board game. The few SW issues are likely to be worked out soon. It is a bit hard to read the text on a phone and some buttons are not very responsive but overall still gives a really good experience.  I wish we can review the game logs post game so we can learn the game better.
Cool game. Played a lot on the board game,  it's nice to play with friend abroad.  I would like to have the game to stay logged when going back and forth between apps.
I have been informed there IS a way to save games in progress. Game is totally awesome. Five Stars, all the way.
replyContent: Offline games are saved automatically after every move.  You can reload a game in progress from the Offline Game List menu.  (Tutorial games, however, are not saved.)

content: Little difficult at first through the tutorial but after finding the boardgame manual and playing several games, it's quite addicting. The physical boardgame requires two players so the online option and AI helps.

This is the all-time highest rated board game come to mobile. Loved the board game, and this is a faithful port. Flawless so far. Can be tricky to learn, but it is one of the few strategy games that can be challenging.  AI is impressive (unlike every other game). The frustration of losing a game is only surpassed by the sweet taste of victory from time to time. Tldr; buy it.
Still some rules glitches.
replyContent: Please contact support@playdekgames.com with the list of rules bugs you've discovered.  We have an update coming within the next few days to address the bugs already reported by our players.

content: Good Port of my Favourite Game
Captures the feel of the difficulty of the major events of the cold war.  It's about about making the least bad choices.
Have been waiting for this for years. Pretty faithful to the tabletop. If you are new to the game it would help to read the rules online.
I just spent two hours being slapped around the middle east and asia by the soviets. Great game and for $5 it's a steal.
Fix the dumb self destructive AI! You LOSE the game by moving the Defcon to 1.
replyContent: The rulebook in the app isn't very clear.  The correct rule is that when DEFCON drops to the 1, the "phasing player" loses the game.  The Phasing Player is the player who's action round it currently is.  We're working to update the rulebook to explain this better in the app.

content: Extreme power drain on my phone, AI takes sometimes way too long to play. Played the board version and loved it, but this version I can't recommend.

Been interested in the board game for over a year and thought I would try this out. It took a bit to learn but it a lot of fun. I have had several games where the AI kill itself and everyone else by purposely dropping the defcon. The game ends and it says the AI wins but everyone is dead.....  No one wins.... I can finish a game because the AI kills us
replyContent: The rulebook in the app isn't very clear.  The correct rule is that when DEFCON drops to the 1, the "phasing player" loses the game.  The Phasing Player is the player who's action round it currently is.  We're working to update the rulebook to explain this better in the app.

content: Perfect port of one of my favourite board games. Brilliant for those with busy lives with asynchronous multiplayer. Cross compatible with steam and iOS. Recommended.
Been laid up in bed all this week with back problems, this game has helped me pass the time. Nice work.

Having never played the boardgame, I wasn't sure if I was going to enjoy this port. However, this is a really fun and challenging game. I haven't stopped playing since it came out, really fun game. Get it!

I didn't see one, but a QR popup button would be nice to remind me what each action does (like which ones allow the opponent to use an event, and that coup is a military action).  5-stars despite the issues with player ramp up.  (Plays on my Acer Chromebook R13 too. Bonus!)

Great game, but knock off a star or two if you're not a fan of the Cold War politics. You can't finish the tutorial (and get the achievement for doing so), but the tutorial glitches after you've learned just about all the rules. About the AI: During the headline phase of each turn, and during certain events,  it takes a long time to decide what to do. Also, if you find the game too easy/hard, there's no level of difficulty, however you can set a handicap. I still can't win an even game.

I am new to the game so I played through the tutorial. My main gripe is the tutorial text is black on a dark gray background and very difficult to read unless I crank up my phone's brightness and blind myself. The tutorial also just coves the basic rules. Afterwords I was left with a few questions. The game also needs a left handed mode.
Glad it's available on phones as well as tablets. Really good job and cross-platform play seals the deal.
Can navigate the menu's on my tablet just won't let me playð¥
replyContent: We released an update earlier this week that should fix the issues on your device.  Please give it another try and let us know if it still doesn't work.  Thanks.

content: Complex,  beautiful,  and perfectly executed on mobile.  Stop reading;  buy now.
Thank you for porting this to Android! Thank you as well for the thorough tutorial. I got the bug in the space race die roll, which I expect you'll fix soon.
The best boardgame in the world just went online - and it rocks. BUY IT!
Love this game. Just like Steam version
Loved the cardboard, iPad, and PC versions. Now I can love the Android one!
UI is easy and intuitive. Tutorial is perfect. Looking forward to many games!

Works very well. The only issue, as highlighted below, the dice does not work during the space race phase of the tutorial. This will put off new gamers. Behind that I am very happy to have a portable version to while away the hours.
Perfect port of the outstanding steam version. Cross-platform play makes this essential for board game lovers.

Played only one game, but I loved the experience so far. The game layout is so well done, cramming everything from the board onto the screen in a way that doesn't feel cluttered and makes sense. I'm impressed!
Love it! 19 Dec 2016
crashes during installation. more testing should have been done
replyContent: Please contact support@playdekgames.com with the details on your device and the version of the OS installed.  We're testing a fix for the game not launching properly on several devices and we'd like to send you a build to confirm that your device is fixed.  Thanks.

content: As good as the steam version so far!
Great digital adaptation of one of the greatest board games around
